page.title: 10Transport
page.content: No form of{public transport}now serves this area. The{railway,}the Station for which is one mile outside Stogumber, was{closed in 1972}under the Beeching Plan. However it reopened under{private ownership}a couple of years later. This is run for{tourists}with steam trains. A{mini bus}owned by Bryants Coaches in Williton takes passengers {twice weekly to Taunton}from Stogumber. Most{families own a car}and this is certainly an essential part of life in this area. Regular{weekly trips } are made by the{farmers to market}for buying and selling stock. {Mothers } need to travel to the town for {shopping.} The nearest{surgery}is {four miles}from the village. Many people{work}outside the area and {commute daily. }
